text.headline: David Thok (Kuany)
text.text:
Jan 1, 1977
Gender: Male
Ethnicity: African/Caribbean
Client ID: DI-ID000033891
Client Type: Shelter
Number of Housing Outcomes: 5

text.headline: CPS Drop Off and EMS Intervention for David Thok
text.text:
David Thok(Thok David) was dropped off by CPS unit #1124 at 10 PM. David had several indentations(one deep head wound seeping blood) as well as a face laceration. CPS stated to door staff that EMS had already checked him out. Staff dressed the wound but a severly intoxicated David pulled an already bloody bandage of his head(David was also complaining of neck pain). Non Emerg EMS were called(unit #2882) transported David to an undisclosed location.

Log ID: LOG00038838

text.headline: David Thok's Health Deterioration and EMS Call
text.text:
Around 1515 client David Thok while waiting for DOAP team to transport to Sheldon Chumir, staff noticed that David's condition and health were getting worse. Severe pain in neck and head was reported to staff. At this time it was decided to call Non-Emerg EMS. EMS unit 2857 arrived at 1545 to attend to David

Log ID: LOG00038966

text.headline: Hospital Release and Request for Day Sleep by David Thok
text.text:
David Thok came in today after being released from the hospital. He showed me some paper work saying that he has a skull fracture and neck strain from injury and asked if we could provide him with daysleep.

Log ID: LOG00039066

text.headline: David Thok's Injury and Hospital Transport
text.text:
Sorry for the late log! Yesterday morning, David Thok came in with a gash beside his eye and a swollen eye, that he was unable to open. I sat him down in a chair and cleaned up the gash beside his eye. I couldn't get him to open his eye, and he wasn't responding to me, he seemed to be drifting out of consciousness and began to shake. Non Emerg was called and unit #2004 arrived approx 3 minutes later @ 3:25am. They were informed of his recent skull fracture and transported him to Rocky View

Log ID: LOG00039322

text.headline: Threatening Outburst by David Thok
text.text:
David Thok had an outburst this evening. He was threatening clients off property and came on property and proceeded to screech about it. He talked a lot about being in a gang and having a knife and a gun (when asked if he had it now, he said he doesnt). In the name of safety for the building a search task has been added. Please search David for weapons

Log ID: LOG00039682

text.headline: David Thok's Unruly Behavior and Temporary Ban
text.text:
Early this morning David Thok was being very loud and belligerent, I attempted repeatedly to encourage David to be considerate and keep the noise down. His volume and very poor attitude persisted even after he was asked to leave intox. CPS was required to help David leave property but needed to arrest David having refused any and all instruction from staff and CPS. David will receive a 7 day bar

Log ID: LOG00000104

text.headline: Aggressive Incident with David Thok and CPS Intervention
text.text:
David Thok was yelling repeatedly in intox. He took much convincing to leave the building and was aggressive and abusive to staff. Once outside he refused to leave property. He referred to the writer as "fucking white boy". He also made the following statements:"Do I owe you money?""Why are you trying to kill me?""If I want to kill you I will kill you where you stand!"David continued yelling and refused to leave property. CPS units 1126 and 1145 arrived and took David into custody. Due to a pattern of yelling and aggression towards staff, David Thok will now be barred conditionally for a minimum of thirty days. He must see the BRC after that point to regain access.

Log ID: LOG00000664

text.headline: Racist Diatribe by David Thok and 2-Day Ban
text.text:
Today at roughly 2000 I assisted in removing an intoxicated David Thok (sober only) off of property. The entire time he was being walked off property David was extremely disrespectful to staff. Once outside the main gate David then went off on a racist diatribe towards myself and other Caucasian staff members, oddly enough calling to me as racist while constantly referring to me as “fucking white boy”. A two day bar is being placed on David for his racial abuse

Log ID: LOG00009073

text.headline: Apology from David Thok for Racist Abuse
text.text:
In relation to log# 178311 that led to a 2 day bar on David Thok for racial abuse towards staff. Today is the first day I have seen David in about a week when the incident took place. David approached me shook my hand and gave me a very sincere apology for his behavior that night. He has been forgiven

Log ID: LOG00009345

text.headline: Building Access Denial and 911 Call by David Thok
text.text:
David THOK attempted to gain access to the building through the guard house front gate. Security Andrew informed David THOK that he would not be accessing the building as he was intoxicated and is currently on a sober only bar. David THOK became verbally aggressive towards Andrew and took it on himself to call 911. CPS unit 1124 attended and David THOK became verbally abusive with officers. CPS officers moved David THOK away from the front gate and Security Austin informed officers that he would call DOAP Team.

Log ID: LOG00009905

text.headline: Racial Abuse and Ejection of David Thok
text.text:
DAVID THOK entered intox presenting as under the influence. When asked what his name is he responded by saying “I don’t like the way white people look.” He was asked to leave politely, due to the racial nature of his comments. He became defiant and refused to leave informing us that he doesn’t like white people but was not going to be leaving. Staff Nick encouraged him to leave and David began posturing as if he wanted to intimidate Nick. David was escorted out by Security Staff Freddy. David is not welcome back for 2 days due to the violation of his sober only condition and the nature of his comments.

Log ID: LOG00010961

text.headline: Verbal Assault and Threat by David Thok, CPS Involvement
text.text:
Earlier this morning at approx. 0535hrs the writer went to speak with an intoxicated David Thok (Guest) in the first floor entrance vestibule. David was removed earlier the night prior for causing a disturbance and being belligerant and was asked to come back at 7am this morning. The writer spoke with David and tried to get him to understand that he needed to come back at 7am, unfortunately David seemingly refused to listen to reason and instead opted to verbally siege Security Staff Joe with a volley of insults and racial slander. The writer eventually convinced David to focus his anger in to filling out a complaint form but this was hastily rejected after David began to refocus his anger on Joe (who was in Bio during this time). The writer eventually had to leave the conversation and it was a this point David told the writer “Hey, what if I were to threaten to stab you right now, huh!? Would that get me what I want”. The writer at this point told David to leave and promptly retreated behind the relative safety of the vestibule doors. CPS (Calgary Police Service) via 911 was called and shortly there after David was removed from property by CPS unit #1131.

Log ID: LOG00011933

text.headline: Dehydration Incident and Recovery of David Thok
text.text:
David Thok was signing in to intox tonight when writer noticed he did not look well. David told writer that he is not feeling well, and slowly started to descend towards the floor until he completely collapsed. Writer called on 1st floor support staff Anthony for assistance, and informed writer that David was found outside by an unknown individual sleeping in the heat of the sun with a winter coat on. It was assumed at this point that David was severely dehydrated, and he was given water to drink until his thirst was quenched (which was after about 1.5 litres of water). He was also assigned medical mat and regularly checked until it was decided that his condition has improved enough for him to be assigned a regular mat. David was provided with a meal and was very grateful for the help that staff provided him.

Log ID: LOG00013117

text.headline: Intoxicated Denial and Disturbance by David Thok
text.text:
Last night at around midnight (September 21, 2014) David Thok (Guest) approached the guard shack wishing to get in to intox for the night. Unfortunately David was heavily intoxicated and was denied entry due to his sober only status. David was carrying around a very large bottle of Vodka with him and was completely unaware of the fact that his penis was hanging out of his pants. The writer tried to convince David to maintain himself, unfortunately though it was all for not as David was so intoxicated he ignored the writer all together on that subject and started on a rant about hating white people but loving the writer. David would eventually leave from in front of the guard shack, and would thankfully end up ‘fixing’ himself

Log ID: LOG00013337

text.headline: Intoxicated David Thok's Arrest by CPS
text.text:
This evening at approximately 19:30 David Thok was asked to leave the building as he was intoxicated in Intox on a Sober Only bar. He sat just outside of the guard shack, momentarily quietly sobering up. Shortly after he began an escalation of belligerence toward staff at the gate. Along with this he was quenching his thirst with a couple more beers. Writer let David know that he is lessening his chances of coming back in by choosing to drink more. He denied it and a friend of his covered for him. At approximately 21:00 Supervisor Rob. L came out to the guard house, at this point David escalated verbally even further. A CPS call was made and when unit B120 arrived, both officers walked David off property, unfortunately he came right back. Since David was unwilling to cooperate with the officers, they decided to arrest him.

Log ID: LOG00013872

text.headline: Theft of David Thok's Phone by Sabrina Jobb
text.text:
David Thok approached staff about his phone that was charging on the north window ledge of the Harm Reduction office. He said his phone had been stolen. Upon reviewing the footage ( DVR 0 Ch. 17 at 12:36-12:38), it appears that Sabrina Jobb stole David's phone. Security staff Corey confronted Sabrina about the phone outside, and when he asked her to give the phone back, she instead spike the phone on the ground as if she had scored a touchdown.Staff Ricardo U. has placed a conditional bar upon Sabrina Jobb.

Log ID: LOG00014900

text.headline: Disturbance and Expulsion of David Thok
text.text:
At 5:00am on 13th of December, 2014. David Thok was asked to leave the Drop In Centre because he was disturbing all the clients on the first floor by picking fights with anyone, being abusive to staffs on the first floor. David Thok was asked to leave the premises because his conditional bar clearly states that David Thok can acess the Drop in Centre facilitates ONLY if he is sober. But David Thok was not sober and T.J asked him to leave the premises. When David Thok was outside the gates of the Drop In Centre, he continued to harrass other clients that were trying to check into the DI. David Thok even made rude remarks at the writer, he referred to the writer as foolish and crazy.

Log ID: LOG00016012

text.headline: Trust Breach and Removal of David Thok from Property
text.text:
Writer unleashed David Thok on the building this morning. He arrived at the gate nodding off with a seemingly peaceful buzz. David shook hands with writer and asked to come in to sleep. Writer said that she would vouch for David to come in, on the condition that he understood that she was 'sticking her neck out' for him, and placing her trust in him. Unfortunately, after a few cigarettes on property his body continued to absorb the alcohol he had just consumed and he could not find it in him to hold his tongue. Writer informed him that he had broken the deal and needed to leave. Staff TJ and Mgr. Mike M. assisted in his removal. On his way out his comments turned racial and angry and he attempted to start a fight in the lobby. Once he exited the building we tapped out to security Reg and staff Dunsten who finished the escort off property.

Log ID: LOG00016032

text.headline: Intervention by David Thok in Fight, Violation of Sober Only Condition
text.text:
Staff were attempting to break up a fight between Robert Montaque and Russ Archer when an inebriated David Thok (who also happens to be on a sober only) decided to intervene - pushing and parrying staff out of the way. Although the fight was quickly put down by staff, David's actions could have potentially made a dangerous situation more difficult for staff to deal with. After the fight David did not seem to understand how his actions put staff at risk. David seems to hold no respect for his sober only conditional and when drunk while in the building David seems to have a penchant for intimidating and disrespecting staff direction. For his actions today and for violating his sober only conditional David will be receiving a 2 day bar.

Log ID: LOG00016800

text.headline: Threats and Intimidation by David Thok Against Staff
text.text:
An intoxicated David Thok (Thok David ) 1977-01-01 was asked to leave property due to his sober only bar. During the time it took for staff to persuade David to make his way off property he very clearly described how he was going to kill staff by shooting us asking us if we “wanted to be shot”. David also made his fingers into the shape of a pistol saying “bang bang” towards staff while telling us how he was going to kill us.

Log ID: LOG00020207

text.headline: Aggressive Physical Assault by David Thok and CPS Intervention
text.text:
This morning at about 0645hrs the writer was outside the front doors along with sec staff Ryan attempting to wake up David Thok. When trying to speak with David verbal contact was a failure and the writer became concerned for the intoxicated David. The writer then though it would be best to try & sit David up and speak with him that way. When the writer and sec staff Ryan attempted to help David up he immediatley went from 0-100 and started swinging punches & kicks at the writer striking him in the face,chest & legs. David even noticed it was the staff who was first trying to help him but continued his physical aggression. The writer, Sec Staff Ryan & Sec Staff Raf then restrained David outside the fron doors. A CPS phone call was made. CPS arrived quickly & made an arrest

Log ID: LOG00020227

text.headline: David Thok's Sobriety and Request for Day Sleep Program
text.text:
David Thok met with Director Abe and myself about his life bar. David stated that he has been sober for 9 months and it has been working out for him. He is presently working nights at the Italian bakery by Chinook, and is in need of our day sleep program. At this time David’s bar has been lifted for day services, with the condition that he is assessed at the door by a supervisor. In a months’ time David can meet with writer to discuss a full lift of his bar

Log ID: LOG00027014

text.headline: David Thok's Confrontation and Eviction from the Building
text.text:
Tonight November 1, 2015 at around 20:30 David Thok (Thok David ) 1977-01-01 wanted to come back in the building, writer informed David that he is on a conditional bar from night services , and that he could not stay for the night, David became verbally aggressive towards me and asked me to call the supervisor to talk to him because I do not know how to do my job, Themba came down to talk to David, but he was not listening, so David was asked to leave the building. While staff was grabbing his stuff from intox, David continued yelling at me f…. you and that I will lose my job, at this moment writer tapped out and Security Zach and Adam walked David off the property

Log ID: LOG00027815

text.headline: Disturbance and Eviction of David Thok
text.text:
On the evening of 1-25-16 the writer heard a disturbance of yelling occurring in the front entrance vestibule. Upon arrival, the writer saw client David Thok (Thok David ) 1977-01-01 being asked to leave by Security Ivan. V. Ivan informed the writer that David was about to start a fight with another client in the front vestibule. The writer and Ivan attempted to get David off property firstly due to his behavior and also due to his current restriction from night services bar. David was acting aggressively by yelling and pointing over at the other client he was about to fight. David would not leave the property when asked by the writer or Security Ivan and got in the writer’s personal space when speaking to him. At one point, spit flew out of David’s mouth while he was talking and landed on the writer. Since David would not calm down or willingly leave property, and was spitting on the writer in his personal space, the situation was assessed to be too much of a hazard if left continued and the writer and Security Ivan. V each grabbed a hold of one of David’s arms and conducted a controlled escort of David to the edge of DI property. The writer believes that David did not intentionally spit on him and was just a result of clumsy speec

Log ID: LOG00031625

text.headline: Bar Lifted and Commitment to Sobriety
text.text:
David Thok: Bar lifted to full services. David states he has been staying sober since his bar and understands that alcohol gets him into a lot of trouble. David took full responsibility for his actions and was very apologetic. He also expressed interests in receiving counselling for addiction, getting into the supportive housing floors and getting Canadian citizenship. He understands that he is on zero tolerance for aggressive behaviour and drinking in the building.

Log ID: LOG00034566

text.headline: Collapse due to Intoxication
text.text:
David Thok collapsed in the bio hallway today due to what was perceived to be extreme intoxication. David would not respond to verbal of pain stimuli so EMS was called. Unit 2862 arrived @ 14:12 and transported David to an unknown location

Log ID: LOG00000191

text.headline: David's Act of Kindness
text.text:
Writer just wanted to write a positive interaction between clients that was led by DAVID. DAVID was in harm reduction and was quite distressed trying to find a blanket. While writer thought the blanket was for himself, but in the end it was for an elderly gentle man that was sleeping cold on the floor with nothing over him. Writer was touched by this and wanted to acknowledge DAVID on his kindness and thoughtfulness towards others

Log ID: LOG00371370

text.headline: Medical Emergency and Hospital Transfer
text.text:
Writer found client David Thok unresponsive in harm reduction. Client not breathing, with a barely palpable pulse. Unresponsive to sternal rub or verbal cues. Writer began compressions and paged a supervisor for assistance. Supervisor Mike and Alvin both attended as well as Nurse Geneveive and Leah. Mike took over compressions, while writer rescue breathed for client. AED applied but no shock advised. Client began to respond shortly after. ACW Kyle called 911, EMS and fire attended and client transferred to an unknown location.Pamadd. Client returned by EMS @ 1307 as client refusing transfer and being combative

Log ID: LOG00004302

text.headline: Improved Attitude and Job Interview
text.text:
Writer was doing a walkthrough in harm reduction when he noticed David Thok giving away his sheets to another client. Writer approached him and commended him on his generosity. After conversing with him for a moment, writer discovered that David was actually about to head out for a job interview. It should also be noted that David’s attitude has been much better than it has been as of recently and possibly more sober than before. All in all, things seem to be taking a positive turn for David and writer thought this was note worthy.

Log ID: LOG00374069

text.headline: Unresponsiveness and EMS Assessment
text.text:
Writer was walking through Intox this afternoon where ACW Mike S was performing a welfare check on client David Thok. David was unresponsive to any pain stimuli or verbal cues, however he had strong breaths and good warm body temperature. Writer initiated an EMS call and EMS unit 2856 arrived on site @ 16:07 and are currently assessing David in Intox

Log ID: LOG00006313

text.headline: Additional Restrictions Placed on David Thok
text.text:
Given his excessive outbursts tonight and history in the building an additional bar has been placed for David Thok. Until Feb 17th, David may not access the first floor sleep program. IF assessed as suitable he may stay on 2nd, 3rd, or 2507. This bar is an effort to move beyond punitive measures and address his behaviour where it occurs. Hopefully it will set a standard to David of utilizing Alpha House when he is under the influence and maintain a positive relationship with our building

Log ID: LOG00006897

text.headline: Bar Lift and Commitment to Sobriety
text.text:
The BRC met with the following individuals and came to the following conclusions:David Thok – Bar Lifted. David was unable to recall the incident for which he received his bar, due to his level of intoxication. David realizes that his drinking is creating adversity for him, with both regards to his housing here at the DI and his employment; David lost 5 jobs in 2016 due to his drinking. David has agreed to be assessed upon entry, if he appears to be intoxicated, and has agreed that if his intoxication level is too high, he will be sent to Alpha House

Log ID: LOG00010902

text.headline: Aggressive Entry and Subsequent Bar
text.text:
Daivid Thok arrived late and under the influence. He ran past the gate onto property following the DOAP van. He was told he wasn't allowed to enter our building or the DOAP van but none the less had to be coerced out of the DOAP van. Several minutes of verbal abuse, racism, threats and aggression followed. As is his custom David refused to leave peacefully and after getting to within an inch of my face while yelling and frothing at the mouth Sec Ivan and I physically walked him most of the way off property. However, he was resistant and becoming combative so he was briefly restrained on the ground until Security could tap me out and walk him off. This is all too familiar with David, and his assessment and bars reflect this. In an effort to give David a hard break from this behaviour he will be barred until he meets the BRC; he will be eligible to meet the BRC on Oct 18 but will need to show some sort of willingness to commit to respectful behaviour.

Log ID: LOG00015605

text.headline: Bar Lifted for David Thok: Acknowledgement of Alcohol Impact
text.text:
ON BEHALF OF TONIGHTS BRC; Diversion Worker Sheila W & SPVR Tyler W:David Thok: BAR LIFTED. David has made significant steps to accountability towards his addiction of alcohol. David has made it clear that he recognizes that his behaviours spike when he is using alcohol and has committed to using alpha house when he is intoxicated. David is aware that he will be subject to an assessment upon entry.

Log ID: LOG00017845

text.headline: Misconduct and One Day Bar
text.text:
While on the floor on 2nd floor David Thok (Thok David) 1977-01-01 appeared to be heavily under the influence of alcohol shouting and yelling at one of his friends. The client was asked to quiet down several times by the writer and ACW Gatwech. At some point in the shift the clients pant s fell and was exposing himself to TL Alhely. ACW Gatwech made some attempts to get David to pull up his pants which he was struggling with. At that time the writer advised the client that he would have spend the night down stairs. The client got in the writers face yelling swearing at the writer claiming that he would end my life David continued with threats and intimidation. One day bar

Log ID: LOG00021041

text.headline: Uncooperative Behavior on 2nd Floor
text.text:
David Thok was quite uncooperative tonight on 2nd. He was roaming around until late, when Writer asked him to go to bed. At 01:35, Writer explained the non-negotiable aspect of the sleep program to Mr. Thok on the smoke deck. Mr. Thok responded with light-hearted jesting and humourous posturing, which in effect functioned as a way to slough off Writer's concerns. Mr. Thok went so far in his jesting to grab Writer around the chest in a tight bear-hug. It was clear that Mr. Thok was not fully cognizant of basic personal boundaries, which were then explained to him. After a little more coaxing, Mr. Thok eventually went to bed. Warning entered for unwelcome physical contact with staff and inability to follow instructions.

Log ID: LOG00021885

text.headline: Assessment of David Thok's Recurring Misconduct
text.text:
In relation to David Thok's bar: although several parts of his behaviour have improved there is still a significant struggle to have him adhere to the building's expectations when he is under the influence. David continually presents as defiant, aggressive, disrespectful and threatening. His past bars indicate where these have eventually lead. For having his bar lifted it would be ideal if David himself could come up with solutions to ensure he can function well in the centre for longer periods of time. Possibly a commitment from him to avoid the centre when he is under the influence could help in this endeavour. At the very least David needs to understand how his actions are perceived by staff, and understand the unwillingness to continually subject ourselves and other clients to these behaviours. His history indicates he has been barred 21 times for mostly similar behaviour since the implementation of his assessment bar, leading to the conclusion it is currently not the most effective option.

Log ID: LOG00022465

text.headline: Dealing with David Thok's Intoxication and Subsequent EMS Call
text.text:
Throughout this past evening, Writer and staff were dealing with a very intoxicated, belligerent, and borderline aggressive Client David Thok (Thok David ) 1977-01-01. At approx. 23:50 hours, DOAP team arrived to transport Client David to Alpha House, but because he was heavily intoxicated, belligerent, and simply just refusing to go (despite agreeing earlier), they unfortunately could not transport him. Several attempts by different staff were made to try and convince Client David to leave property. But, Client David decided to stay put in the front vestibule. Supervisor Sarah spoke with Client David, and he did eventually go outside; but, not before throwing used sheets at her face, excessively yelling and swearing at her; referring to her as a “bitch”. It was not long later before Client David made his way back inside, and made himself comfortable once again in the front vestibule. Writer and Supervisor Sarah approached Client David again to speak with him, however we found him with very shallow breathing and was unresponsive to extensive pain stimuli (via behind the ear and a sternum rub). Decision was made to call EMS due to possible alcohol poisoning, or unknown otherwise. EMS Unit #2958 arrived and transported him to an unknown location.

Log ID: LOG00022617

text.headline: Bar Lift and Discussion of Future Behaviour
text.text:
David Thok: Bar LIFTED. The BRC acknowledges that this has become a revolving door with David and challenged him to find ways to show staff he is capable of staying in the building without incident. David acknowledges that his behaviour is unacceptable when he is intoxicated and expressed a genuine desire to cut back on alcohol. It was strongly suggested that David reside at Alpha House if intoxicated. Supervisors will continue to assess David at biometrics.Continued in next log...

Log ID: LOG00022637

text.headline: Observations on David Thok's Declining Mental Health
text.text:
Mar 11/2018Writer has noticed a decline in David Thok's mental health. This morning writer was sitting beside David and at different moments he was speaking to someone that was not present. At one moment he pointed at no one and stated “I am going to slit your throat with a knife. When writer prompted on who he was speaking to he began to state that he(David) is a lost boy. He made references to Ethiopia and that he was lost and also related to Emmanuel Jal. Writer is noting the odd interaction with David as he has steadily been declining. Please log any similar interactions

Log ID: LOG00386385

text.headline: David Thok and Another Client Found Unconscious
text.text:
Writer was alerted by a concerned client that there were two men down just west of the main building towards the corner of 4th avenue and 3rd St SE. Writer along with security staff Ken arrived to find David Thok and Temesghen Berkhetab both unconscious and unresponsive in the old Cecil parking lot. Writer initiated a 911 call with EMS and CFD both responding. Temesghen was able to be aroused and deemed heavily under the influence of alcohol and assisted back into the building. David was much more difficult to arise and required medical attention thus was transported VIA EMS to an unknown medical facility

Log ID: LOG00029419

text.headline: Sobriety and Full-Time Employment
text.text:
Spoke with David yesterday morning and he informed me that he has been sober for over a month now. He has also has gained fulltime employment at a warehouse. He stated he plans on saving up and getting his own place in the near future. This is very good news because as we all know David was really struggling with alcohol, and his mental health. He is a completely different person when he is sober, and a fantastic human being. I told him how proud I was of him, and to continue on this positive journey to achieving long term sobriety. Let's all support David anyway we can to help him stay on this positive path.

Log ID: LOG00387900

text.headline: Struggle with Personal Loss and Continued Sobriety
text.text:
Writer connected with David Thok today. He is still searching for housing but has had to pause since he has recently had to deal with the passing of his mother. David is still working full-time and is doing well with maintaining his sobriety. Please try and connect with David to provide him with support during this difficult time.

Log ID: LOG00031139

text.headline: David Thok's Two-Week-Old Wound Treatment
text.text:
David came in to bio hallway and asked writer for a band aid, writer noticed a fairly big open wound but not bleeding. Writer brough david in and sat him in front of riverfront office. David stated that he has had this wound for about two weeks now, and everytime he showered that skin would come off. Writer applied a loose bandage of gauze and tape, and told david to speak with the nurses about further care of the wound. David thanked the writer and left the building.

Log ID: LOG00031419

text.headline: Night Services Access Granted for David Thok
text.text:
David Thok - David would like to be able to access night services as his employment situation has changed and he is working very late on most nights. David has cut down on his drinking and has been respectful to staff so BRC agreed that allowing him night services is reasonable at this time. David is very interested in getting housed and provided his contact information for the diversion/case management teams. Bar lifted

Log ID: LOG00033411

text.headline: David Thok's Misconduct and Inappropriate Remarks
text.text:
ACW Tim came to writer to inform he had caught David T with a ¾ full bottle of vodka, and that when he approached, David emptied the bottle immediately. When writer and Tim talked to David about this he got very angry used some colorful language. Writer re addressed the situation with him shortly after he had left and come back to 2nd floor and asked for a search. David proceed to accuse writer of wanting to search him so she could molest him. Writer asked ACW Tim to do the search with David. David proceeded to make sexual comments to ACW Chelsea “ Your Ass looks great in those pants” and was reported from a client that David was making these same type of comments to other female client.

Log ID: LOG00038911

text.headline: David Thok's Aggressive Behavior and Seven-Day Bar
text.text:
During the lunch hour, writer was on the second floor when a visibly intoxicated David Thok arrived to get himself some lunch. He swore at ACW Terry, and I approached to have a conversation and offer him lunch on the first floor. However, before any conversation could be had, David said “Fuck off, bitch”. I told him he could not speak to me like that and he had would now need to leave. David then raised his hand in ager towards me and began posturing aggressively. I backed away and tried to talk to him, telling him his reaction was not okay, and again stating he had to leave, as ACW Lynaya approached, telling him it was not okay to raise his hand towards me. He then postured towards her, again raising his hand. At this point security stepped in to escort him out. On his way off the floor, David aggressively postured towards another client and then continued struggling with security. A minimum 7 day bar, must meet BRC has been placed as a result.

Log ID: LOG00039719

text.headline: Unconscious David Thok Picked Up By DOAP Team
text.text:
DOAP Team arrived to pick up David Thok. I found David in the entrance vestibule, unconscious but breathing. Security Christian and I tried to arouse David with several pain stimuli, however David was completed unconscious. After several minutes of attempting to arouse a response from David, EMS was called. Unit 3007 responded. One of the paramedics attempted to intubate David which did cause David to cough out the tube, however he went back to being completely unresponsive shortly after. EMS transported David to an unknown location.

After some time having failed conversations with David, Sup Elise decided to put down a non-emerge call for the removal of David. CPS units# 1449, 1112, 1142 arrived to arrest David and took him to undisclosed location.

The Decision was made to step off property as there were multiple clients attempting to hold David Thok (Thok David) 1977-01-01 down and stop him from fighting. Once the fight was separated, David continued to attempt to attack clients multiple times and come onto property. At this point the writer and Jaimey advised David CPS had already been called and it was best for him to leave. David refused and began to threaten other clients and staff calling them "F*cking B*itches" and telling clients to "shut the f*ck up" and continuing to say "I'll f*ucking kill you" to multiple different clients. David then turned to the writer and told him "I'll f*cking shoot you" and proceeded to tell Supervisor Jaimey "I promise to break your nose" These threats on staff continued for about 5 more minutes until CPS arrived and arrested David on Dermot Baldwin Way

Writer placed his hands on David to gain space and disengage with David. A 266 call was placed and CPS Unit #1128 arrived and placed David under arrest. THOK was immediately uncompliant but not overly aggressive until Writer and ACW Sean B followed him out onto the 2nd Floor Smoke Deck, at which time THOK entered ACW Sean B's personal space and began to shout at him. Security was radioed for additional support and SEC Chloe V arrived at the 2nd Floor Smoke Deck to assist. Her presence and involvement calmed THOK who poured one of his drinks down the drain and gave ACW Sean B the other to empty. Writer had a discussion with THOK explaining that he needed to avoid escalating and yelling while he was on the floor and ACW Sean B had a similar conversation with THOK, stating that THOK would need to leave the building if he had any more incidents. THOK was reasonably well behaved until 12:45PM at which time Writer witnessed him unprovoked shove another client and posture at him in the 2nd Floor Men's Washroom. Writer separated the two clients and asked THOK to leave the floor. THOK took a significant period of time to leave, to the point that SEC Chloe V arrived on the floor to assist Writer with helping THOK leave. THOK eventually did leave property and Acting SUP Nicole E placed a CAT 2 Bar on THOK due to hi having multiple CAT 1 Bars from the last week period, minor harm caused to another client, a failure to deescalate and unwanted physical touching with Writer and SEC Chloe V.

Security had footage of David and another client drinking just outside the main doors and when asked to leave for an hour by SEC Lee David then escalated. As David made his way back into the bio hallway attempting to go to riverfront, writer stepped in front of David so he didn't make it through the last bio door. As writer tried to divert David a different direction by pushing back on his chest, David put his forearm up to writers chest and shoved writer back while continuing to escalate; SEC then locked the last bio door so David could not re-enter the building. Writer went to grab a pair of jeans from his David's locker and was quickly reprimanded by David saying writer was 'dumb' for getting him the wrong pair of jeans, and the right pair was on his mat. Writer retrieved everything off of David's mat while SEC Lee and Chloe finally managed to escort David off property. Writer spoke with David after the incident and explained that although he may be frustrated and angry, he cannot use his hands in any form of retaliation towards anyone at anytime. David expressed remorse however due to the sheer amount of time it took to escort him out of the building, David's escalation and unwanted touching, he has been given a CAT 2: 24/hour bar.

text.text:

text.headline: David Thok Exhibits Verbal Aggression and Inappropriate Physical Contact
text.text:
Around 11:50PM on September 22nd 2022 Writer was in the Bio Office and observed client DAVID THOK (01/01/1977) escalating towards SEC Adnan S in the Lobby following being prompted by ACW Kiane M for a search, leading to him presenting with verbal aggression, clenched fists and moving progressively closer to SEC Adnan S. Writer responded to the Lobby and was able to capture THOK's attention due to previous rapport, eventually leading to him agreeing to utilize an amnesty tote for the large bottle of alcohol he was carrying. However while he was toting it THOK proceeded to drink from the bottle which lead to SEC Adnan S prompting him to leave property and THOK responding by once more becoming aggressive towards him. Writer was able to recapture his attention and due to his high level of intoxication it was decided that THOK could remain on property provided he was not aggressive further to staff. Writer then began to walk THOK towards Riverfront at which time he informed Writer that if he "was a women, [he] would want to be with Writer" and proceeded to grab Writer's left shoulder. Writer initially assumed the contact was due to THOK tripping as a result of intoxication, however THOK then moved to touch the right side of Writer's chest with his right hand and Writer moved their shoulder to block/stop the contact by turning inward. The contact was then played off a friendly contact until THOK's hand was also moved from Writer's shoulder after which he reiterated the previous comment towards Writer of if he was a women, before being redirected into Riverfront by Writer. Writer did not request THOK leave property due to level of intoxication and lack of clear intent regarding the contact with Writer. Logging for posterity.

Log ID: LOG00492787

text.headline: Medical Concerns Raised as David Thok Found Unresponsive at Shelter
text.text:
At around 5:30 this afternoon writer noticed client DAVID THOK slumped over in his chair on second floor. Writer tried to wake him verbally and with a small shoulder shake but got no response. writer then performed a strong sternum rub and still got no response. Writer assisted by ACW Amanda, called for a nurse assessment and a supervisor and got assistance from surrounding coworkers. a Nurse came for an assessment and put DAVID on oxygen as he was sitting at about 86% and also attempted to get him responsive using many methods including sternum rubs and a trap squeeze. The nurse checked DAVIDS eyes with a penlight while writer held DAVIDS head up and she reported that he had pinpoint pupils. DAVID is known to be a heavy drinker but is not known to use drugs, however under the circumstances and not knowing if someone had slipped him anything or he decided to try something new, all staff involved agreed to administer Naloxone to be safe. The first dose was given at 5:42, and the second at 5:46 and a 911 call was placed by ACW Amanda. Paramedics arrived on scene at approximately 6:05 and did a check of all of DAVIDS vitals. DAVID responded to the needles by moving his leg away but throughout the assessment DAVID still did not open his eyes or give any verbal response. After a thorough assessment it was decided that DAVID would use a medical matt in the lobby and checked on a regular basis. Paramedics recommended that if he remained unresponsive in a couple hours to give them a call back. DAVID had to be lifted into a wheelchair and was taken to a matt in the lobby while his possessions were temporarily put in riverfront for safe keepings. writer hopes DAVID recovers swiftly and thanks the nurses for their prompt and dedicated care.
